name: Commonwealth, Appellant, v. Provident Trust Company of Philadelphia

judges: Before Simpson, Kephart, Schaffer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
parties: Commonwealth, Appellant, v. Provident Trust Company of Philadelphia

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The judgment in this case is affirmed on the final opinion of President Judge Hargest.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Philip S. Moyer, with him Charles J. Margiotti, Attorney General, for appellant.
George Ross Hull, of Snyder, Hull, Hull & Leiby, with him MacCoy, Brittain, Evans & Lewis and Morgan, Lewis & Bockius, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth, Appellant, v. Provident Trust Company of Philadelphia
(No. 1).
Argued May 27, 1935.
Before Simpson, Kephart, Schaffer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
June 29, 1935:
Philip S. Moyer, with him Charles J. Margiotti, Attorney General, for appellant.
George Ross Hull, of Snyder, Hull, Hull & Leiby, with him MacCoy, Brittain, Evans & Lewis and Morgan, Lewis & Bockius, for appellee.
